      • terminateMenu

        public void terminateMenu()
        Terminates the TUI.

      • determinePlayer

        public boolean determinePlayer()
        Determines if the user wants to play as human or as Computerplayer. Depending on the answer, the TUI asks the Client to create the respective player.
        Returns:
        true if the user wants to play as Human and false if he wants to let the Computer play.

      • determineDimensions

        public boolean determineDimensions()
        Determines if the player wants to play with default or own dimensions.

        Asks for a port number to connect to.
        Returns:
        port number.

      • determinePlayerName

        public java.lang.String determinePlayerName()
        The method asks for the user's player's name.
        Returns:

      • determineStrategy

        public java.lang.String determineStrategy()
        The method asks with which strategy the user's Computerplayer should play. It does not check if the given strategy exists.

      • getXDimension

        Asks the specific x dimension.

      • readBoolean

        public java.lang.Boolean readBoolean(java.lang.String message,
                                     java.lang.String yes,
                                     java.lang.String no)
        Determines whether the user enters Yes or No.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to print on the screen.
        yes - String that should be interpreted as "yes".
        no - String that should be interpreted as "no".
        Returns:
        true or false, depending on the input of the user.

      • getInt

        public int getInt(java.lang.String message)
        The method asks the client for a valid integer: positive integer or -1 for unlimited dimension.
        Returns:
        entered dimension.

      • readCoordinates

        public TowerCoordinates readCoordinates(java.lang.String format)
        Reads the coordinates provided by the user. It only ensures the coordinates are indeed integers, not if they are valid towers.
        Parameters:
        message - Message that should be printed.
        Returns:
        Coordinates that the player entered.

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String message)
        Gets a string from the Terminal.
        Parameters:
        message - message to write on the Terminal
        Returns:
        Line entered by the user.
